data.title: Clean up refinery and harvester docking sequence logic
data.body:
This has been bugging me for a long time now, so I finally decided to address it.
@Phrohdoh mentioned a few days ago on IRC that he wants to do some work on refineries, so if this is conflicting with his work we'll just close it for later (if needed), since it's not a feature or a bug fix.
Basically what I did:
- Rename TiberiumRefinery -> TiberiumDawnRefinery (only Tiberian Dawn mod uses it)
- Rename HarvesterDockSequence -> TDHarvesterDockSequence (same reason)
- Rename OreRefinery -> Refinery  (since both RA and Dune 2000 mods uses it)
- Rename RAHarvesterDockSequence -> HarvesterDockSequence  (same reason)
- Fixed a typo in RefineryInfo's DockAngle's description

data.title: Polished allies03a
data.body:
- added difficulties
- removed prisoner hack
- added a description in order to fix #7084 

PS: What about something like "As we don't want to engage (too many) soviet reinforcements,
I'll need your explicit orders to fire, Commander!" instead of "The area is crowded with civilians"?

data.title: Add countries to ra
Speed up shroud rendering using cell changed notifications
data.body:
Using the CellEntryChanged event introduced in #7057, this PR utilises it in the ShroudRenderer in order to track changes in the shroud, and prevent repeated work.

By keeping a cache of pre-calculated vertices for the shroud, they do not need to be recalculated every single frame vastly reducing the work required. In testing I saw CPU time used by the RenderShroud method drop from 27% to 14%.

(Here's hoping I haven't screwed this up somehow!)

Depends on #7071.

data.title: Target prescanning provided by other traits to AutoTarget
data.body:
AutoTargetDamaged can be used by AutoTarget to select damaged targets first.
Depends on #6940.

data.title: Make FrozenActorsInBox a streaming enumerable.
data.body: I basically missed this when I rewrote the other ActorsInBox methods in #5679 some time ago. Same idea - avoid building an extra list and keep the stream lazy should anybody ever only enumerate part of it.

data.title: AI harvesters will worse case path find every second when there are no resources
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/5332699/35b3429c-7e60-11e4-877a-7ed5d852d688.png)

data.title: Block copy palettes
data.body:
In HardwarePalettes.ApplyModifiers, we achieve a 2x speedup (reducing overall time spent in this method from 4.3% to 2.2%) by block copying the palettes.

Since palettes are internally implemented as arrays, a CopyToArray method has been added to allow palettes to be block copied. This makes copy operations 10x faster, meaning they now consume only 0.2% of overall time instead of 2.2%.

data.title: Fixed infantry without idle animation never returning to stand
data.body: leaving it into a firing state. Like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6331, but not destroying the case where we have idle sequences.

data.title: Converted sequence ticks to proper game ticks
data.body: As discussed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6389 the `Tick:` in the sequence definitions is not actually a game tick, but a value in milliseconds that gets processed in a function that uses game ticks again. That is not only contra-intuitive for modders, but also poses a problem when using values that are not divisible by 40. This tidies this relic up with the help of an automated upgrade rule whose results have been hand cleaned to avoid loosing inline comments.

data.title: Fix aircraft fly endlessly in a circle when ordered to attack inside own...
data.body:
... turning radius

Fixes #7083 

This fixed is based on the minimum range of the aircraft's weapons and seems to be working quite well. If the target is inside the minimum attack radius of the aircraft, it simply does an extra attack run turn before attacking.

data.title: RA SP - AI gets mental and starts killing its own/allied units
data.body:
As you can see from the picture below, Monster Tank got mad on _Monster Tank Madness_ and started killing off allied structures. Flame towers guarding entrance first, now the walls. I don't think I've noticed this before, although I've played this map only once or twice.

![mtm_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6183869/5330961/9083ed16-7e15-11e4-88b7-7a012e029aa1.png)

data.title: units don't stop shooting even when stance is changed and unit moved
data.body:
May be I'm doing something wrong here, but-

I've noticed this in RA SP mission _Monster Tank Madness_. Your units cross/come over the bridge and you have a small Soviet base to clear out, naval yard to cap(I think) and then move on.
- clear out soldiers and flame towers
- then order one of your tanks to start shooting at or get him within shooting of any building
- change stance to HoldFire
- yet the tank keeps on shooting
- move tank away from the building - you can tell he keeps on tracking his target
- move tank back close to the building, resp. withing firing range - firing resumes even though unit is in HoldFire stance
- unless of course stance is changed by moving unit around. Which probably isn't true, because cycling stance for given unit cycles stances in expected and continuous order where we left off
- once the building is capped, target is released

**EDIT:** actually being within shooting range is enough to trigger this. It also can be reproduced by placing target on the ground/map via CTRL. Once the target is acquired, unit won't give it up.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6831716-units-don-t-stop-shooting-even-when-stance-is-changed-and-unit-moved?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed color and overlap glitches in the Dune 2000 build palette
data.body: https://github.com/alessandrofrancesconi/gimp-plugin-bimp/ came in handy as I had fix up (resize the frame and bucket fill weird colored pixels on the borders) for 55 individual frames.

data.title: explanation why Tanya won't auto-shoot is missing from mission description
data.body:
As discussed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7080, explanation of some sorts why Tanya or any other unit won't auto shoot should be put into mission description in order to avoid confusion.

Mailaender has proposed ``"The area is crowded with civilians. Tanya needs your explicit orders to fire."'' which sounds reasonable.

data.title: Aircraft fly endlessly in a circle when ordered to attack inside own turning radius
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Use either MiG or Yak that's in flight 
2a. Ctrl + Right click on ground really close\* to where the aircraft is flying
2b. Right click on enemy unit that is really close to where the aircraft is flying
*Doesn't have to be the same grid, inside the aircraft's turning raidus seems to be enough.

Both 2a and 2b can be used to reproduce the bug. Expected behavior would be that the aircraft enters an attack run pattern directly, which it does after successfully firing otherwise.  
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6829621-aircraft-fly-endlessly-in-a-circle-when-ordered-to-attack-inside-own-turning-radius?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Removed the need to give NPCs fake objectives to properly end the game
data.body: This simplifies setting up single-player objectives a lot. The behavior outlined in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6377#issuecomment-53992565 was pretty wonky. I noticed while trying to fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7068. When Tanya gets killed, it would automatically mark Einstein as killed and vice versa.

data.title: allies03a - Tanya doesn't auto-attack nearby enemies
data.body:
This might not be limited only to allies03a. Tanya doesn't attack nearby enemies(those who are in her shooting range) nor shoots back when shot at. Since units in C&C SP and D2K (skrimmish) do, I presume this is a bug.

tags: red alert, bug

data.title: Unhardcoded and self-documented the mobile cursor definitions
data.body: as wished in #7074.

data.title: allies03a - Tanya blows herself up with the bridge
data.body: I thought this happens only on the last and third bridge, but it actually happens on any bridge, I guess. Tanya puts down C4 and instead of walking away, she stays on the bridge and off she goes. This might not be limited only to RA SP.

data.title: Dog jumps up the hill
data.body:
I guess this shouldn't be possible, but dog jumped up this cliff and killed Tanya. :) Picture is from RA SP Allied mission 03a _Dead End_. There is a small unit stationed below this cliff with one dog.

![dog_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6183869/5327722/8e3b091c-7d5d-11e4-8052-c0d11731a99b.png)

data.title: barbed wire can be shot through under specific circumstances
data.body:
It seems like barbed wire acts like a wall under certain conditions. This is most notable or can easily be reproduced in RA Allied mission 03a called _Dead End_ as shown on the picture below. You can see Tanya is standing, becase she isn't under fire from those two soldiers on the other side of the barbed wire. Actually, barbed wire got destroyed couple moments later, because they were shooting it. However, if those soldiers or Tanya would move, they could shoot through barbed wire as expected. In other words, there is a bug somewhere?

![barbed_wire_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6183869/5327672/e7c02434-7d5a-11e4-803b-4e10dbec37c2.png)

data.body: as described in #4521.

data.title: Movement Cursors
data.body:
We should expose cursors to yaml for traits such as Mobile and AttackMove.

If we already do this in all cases I have missed the code.

data.title: Added official Travis C# support
Move FMV playback from Lua scripts to widgets
Avoid redundant cell <-> map conversions
data.body:
The CellRegion and CellLayer classes prefer map-coords internally since they can be used more directly for array indexing, but their APIs all expose cell co-ordinates.

The lead to a particularly bad case where enumerating the cells of a region would do map->cell conversions for you, only to use those cells as an indexer into a layer which would convert the cell back into a map co-ordinate. All the round trips are quite expensive since so many are performed.

This PR adds the ability to enumerate a region in map-coords and then uses this ability in several key places to index into the layer using those map-coords. I didn't fix every use since there's so many.

data.title: Rename some conditions

Give conditions names that reflect that they are conditions instead of upgrades now..
Depends on #7069.
